meanings.definition: The practice of magic performed by a wizard.
meanings.sent1: The children were amazed by the wizardries of the magician at the birthday party.
meanings.sent2: She studied the ancient texts to learn the wizardries of the sorcerer.
meanings.sent3: The wizardries of the magician turned a simple hat into a rabbit!
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of herbal remedies seemed like wizardries to those around her.
meanings.sent5: The wizardries of the sorcerer were so powerful, they could change the course of history.

meanings.definition: Skill or ability in magic or sorcery.
meanings.sent1: His wizardries in potion-making were unmatched in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The old wizard passed down his wizardries to his apprentice.
meanings.sent3: The wizardries of the sorcerer were put to the test during the battle.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking and wizardries in spellcasting saved the day.
meanings.sent5: The wizardries of the magician were so precise, they never failed to impress.
